title: Biological activity of lyophilized chitosan scaffolds with inclusion of chitosan and zinc oxide nanoparticles
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,13565-13582
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA00371C, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Jorge Eliecer Viloria Angarita, Daniel Insuasty, Juan David Rodríguez M., Jorge Iván Castro, Carlos Humberto Valencia-Llano, Paula A. Zapata, Johannes Delgado-Ospina, Diana Paola Navia-Porras, Alberto Albis, Carlos David Grande-Tovar
Zinc oxide and chitosan nanoparticles were incorporated into scaffolds by lyophilization. The scaffolds exhibit antibacterial activity and biocompatibility under in vivo subdermal implantations, exhibiting potential for biomedical applications.
